column1: P.S. We will get through this pandemic but it will take all of us working together.   Please follow the guidelines set in your community to help slow the spread of COVID-19 and continue to wash your hands wear a mask and social distance.

Very sorry to hear my friend @opoapresident Sgt. Tony Conner is in critical condition with COVID. Praying for him his family & his doctors as he battles this virus.   Please continue to help one another & take steps to stop the spread. #WearaMask #SocialDistance #WashYourHands

Our service members veterans & their families know what it means to sacrifice during the holidays.  As we adjust our thanksgiving plans to protect our loved ones from COVID-19 I encourage everyone to give thanks to these patriots for their dedication to defending our freedom. https://t.co/JoIzf5jWDy

I’d like to set the record straight that I started posting about COVID and the importance of taking steps to stop the spread on March 15. Getting information out is important.  #WearaMask #StayHome #SocialDistance https://t.co/mQv7F9EFW0
Wear a mask social distance wash your hands.

COVID-19 cases and hospitalizations are rising to an alarming level in our state. This op-Ed in @OWHNews by NE medical professionals is a must-read for every Nebraskan.   Be responsible. We all need to do our part to stop the spread. https://t.co/uVdyHtNqRB
Wear a mask. Wash your hands. Social distance. https://t.co/h21fP0Ftwa

Our railroaders are facing challenges due to COVID-19. The harmful reduction of their regular unemployment & sickness benefits are making it worse.   I am a cosponsor of the bipartisan Railroad Employee Equality and Fairness Act to fix this problem. More: https://t.co/B8oN2sC1WY
Bruce and I are grateful that we have both tested negative for COVID-19. Our prayers are with @realdonaldtrump @FLOTUS and everyone who is affected by this virus.

COVID-19 has shown the vital work our ag and livestock haulers do and has highlighted the need to modify hours-of-service exemptions so they can continue doing their jobs.   More information and testimonies on why the HAULS Act is needed: https://t.co/NMbCeeCHYO https://t.co/JvOE82Mspq

Today's @SenateCommerce hearing on data privacy is especially important as COVID-19 has increased online activity. My colleagues and I recently introduced data privacy legislation that includes my DETOUR Act to protect against deceptive online interfaces. Tune in today @ 10 a.m. https://t.co/BueUK0fZ0e

From COVID-19 to last year’s Holcomb plant fire to tough market conditions our cattle producers have faced a difficult few years. To address these ongoing challenges I have introduced the Cattle Market Transparency Act of 2020.    Learn more here: https://t.co/3AiIPsuRCE https://t.co/UIESVJKiBb
I was glad to hear their community updates on the challenges and successes they have had combatting COVID-19 and how they have benefited from funding through the CARES Act.

Today @FEMA announced a $62 million grant is heading to NE to fund protective measures & respond to COVID-19. I appreciate @realDonaldTrump issuing the emergency declaration that ensured our state could access this funding which will promote the health & safety of Nebraskans.

While we are still recovering from COVID-19 there are signs that we are bouncing back. Read in this week’s column how Opportunity Zones and CARES Act funding are helping us overcome this pandemic. https://t.co/Pg7ioWK6vI
Even after COVID-19 interrupted our booming economy it's important to remember that there are still good things happening for Nebraska that are worth celebrating.

COVID-19 has brought significant mental health challenges. This is why @SenTinaSmith and I introduced the bipartisan #ATTAIN Mental Health Act that would create a dashboard to assist schools and organizations in applying for mental health grants. https://t.co/VrGvuj8fcO

There is a mental health crisis in this country & COVID-19 has only made it worse. This is why I have joined @SenTinaSmith to introduce the #ATTAIN Mental Health Act to create an online dashboard that would assist applicants applying for federal mental health grants. https://t.co/dJla6nzrn7

Thank you @realDonaldTrump for taking this step to ensure rural Americans will continue to have access to quality health care during and after this pandemic. I’ve been a long advocate for telehealth services and COVID-19 has made it clear how important this is for Nebraskans. https://t.co/e7plMQMn7m

It’s heartwarming to see students at @SchuylerCentral’s summer program using their skills and time to sew extra masks for those in need in their community. Together we can continue slowing the spread of COVID-19 in Nebraska! https://t.co/JoE5UmHPN6

COVID-19 is causing a hunger crisis. Too many Americans are unsure where their next meal will come from. Food banks in NE are working hard to meet increased need but Congress must act.   We should work to increase SNAP and provide for the hungry during this pandemic. https://t.co/L3C4qDZNpp

I appreciate the @USDA’s work investigating market manipulation in the cattle industry following the Holcomb fire and the impact of COVID-19.    Their analysis of what occurred underscores the immediate need for reforms to strengthen the cattle industry.

.@SenateCommerce Subcommittee on Manufacturing Trade and Consumer Protection is LIVE now with a hearing on how scammers are exploiting the #COVID19 pandemic. Tune in as we listen to experts and explore ways to keep Americans protected. https://t.co/JBCkoQUBY6

I joined @SenJackyRosen to introduce the bipartisan KEEP Telehealth Option Act which would provide the government with valuable information on how expanded telehealth services have saved lives during #COVID19. https://t.co/hKPKQVSGNW

With fewer flights due to #COVID19 our airports are hurting and could receive significantly less @FAANews  funding. Read this week’s column on how my bipartisan bill will provide our airports more certainty as they plan for the future. https://t.co/lcqvIn0zrp
P.S. As you celebrate this year please don’t forget to wash your hands social distance and wear your mask!

🚨New Bill: Due to #COVID19 several Nebraska airports are at risk of receiving significantly less funding for future projects. Today I introduced the bipartisan AIR Act to temporarily adjust funding calculations to give airports a clearer sense of the funding they can expect.

More Americans are going hungry because of the #COVID19 crisis.   To help address this problem I led this bipartisan push to ensure food not only gets to the food bank or non-profit but that it reaches the people who need it most. https://t.co/kAcnkNVbeW

Pleased that @MEPNebraska will receive $300k through the CARES Act to help #NE manufacturers respond to the #COVID19 pandemic.   This critical funding will help these manufacturers accelerate the production of PPE & recover from marketplace disruptions.  https://t.co/x1NUdBobVS
As #COVID19 has disrupted our lives many Nebraskans still need help navigating confusing federal regulations.   My staff and I are here to help you solve these problems.

Glad to see the @FCC COVID-19 Telehealth Program authorized by the #CARESAct award funding to Faith Regional Health Services in Norfolk. This will expand remote care to treat COVID-19 & other patients from the safety of home.   Telehealth is critical to our #COVID19 response. https://t.co/WdHpaCRcxF

NE students deserve the same level of opportunity in their education & unequal access to the internet is a major obstacle to this goal.   Read how #COVID19 has shed light on this problem & how I’m working to solve it for good: https://t.co/diUucLFnvn https://t.co/H5fUSTWdIn

COVID19 has created an environment of frustration uncertainty & anxiety for many Nebraskans. If you are struggling w/ a mental health issue don’t be afraid to ask for help. Find out how you can contact @NEDHHS and @BoysTown 24/7 in my weekly column here: https://t.co/aOq1pkfnoB

.@USDA’s Coronavirus Food Assistance Program is already getting payments out to Nebraska ag producers.  Here’s an update thus far on $ to NE ag:  Row Crops: $14 million  Livestock: $19 million Dairy: $394000 https://t.co/wJUFrkxsHQ

#COVID19 has drastically affected #NE students forcing them to complete the school year from home. This was especially hard for students who lack reliable internet connectivity.   That's why I held an e-roundtable w/ leaders on how to better support students going forward. https://t.co/FQdeWDu9HM

This weekend is about taking time to honor the Americans who lost their lives fighting for our county. This year may be different due to #COVID19 but Nebraskans are finding new ways to pay tribute to our fallen heroes. #MemorialDay 🇺🇸 https://t.co/E54QRTEMgE

#COVID19 has impacted how many state motor vehicle enforcement agencies utilize federal grants. Our legislation will increase their flexibility to use federal dollars as they keep Americans safe on the road.   Read More: https://t.co/FubGBMv35w

Today’s new guidance for the @USDA's Coronavirus Food Assistance Program will provide much needed relief to many of Nebraska’s hardworking farmers and ranchers impacted by #COVID19.   Thank you @realDonaldTrump for your leadership in protecting our ag producers.

To all ag producers who are interested in applying for direct payments through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program: The @USDA is hosting a webinar to help explain the application process starting at 1 p.m. ET tomorrow.  Register Here: https://t.co/jfMVLC6gCj

It’s inspiring how Nebraskans are working together to combat #COVID19 on all fronts. I had the honor of sharing these stories on the Senate floor so history will remind everyone how our state responded to this pandemic. #LoveNE  Full Video: https://t.co/GiDIARAsJk https://t.co/vA5pJ8dLTY

#IoT devices were already improving our lives before #COVID19. Now they are helping keep us safe and connected as we battle this virus.   Read in this week’s column how I’m advocating to develop this technology while keeping private information protected.  https://t.co/H1mYqwCovj
I’m about to go live with @AmericaNewsroom to discuss the negative impacts of COVID-19 on our ag producers.   Tune in to Fox News. https://t.co/j1q4yVBn0R

Today we give thanks to all the nurses who have dedicated their lives to caring for others.   The COVID-19 crisis reminds us how important the job they do every day is. Nurses we are so grateful for your service! #NationalNursesDay 👏 👏👏 https://t.co/LlnULovuSr

From masks to respirators to housing relief federal funds continue to flow into Nebraska. These resources are helping our families communities and small businesses as they combat the effects of #COVID19.   Here are some highlights: https://t.co/ba0PqKggVW

I'm thankful for the #COVID19 relief that's going to #NE families hospitals communities and small businesses. Through the steps taken by @realDonaldTrump’s admin & congress these resources are helping us battle this pandemic.   Read more here: https://t.co/HqoHzXYDaU

.@USAGov has a helpful webpage on #COVID19 with resources debunking rumors updates on your stimulus payments and more information on what the federal government is doing to combat this virus. https://t.co/I3amdkmgUo

#COVID19 has made it difficult for many families to put food on their table but tough times often bring out the best in Nebraskans.   In this week’s column I highlight organizations that are doing great work to provide relief to those in need. https://t.co/5jx0ftJVIg

I joined my Senate colleagues in sending a bipartisan letter to @realDonaldTrump asking him to wave the payment limits in the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program to support our farmers and ranchers.  Read our letter ⬇️ https://t.co/3X4e244kYL https://t.co/VZcE3dQCs3

Responding to #COVID19 requires cooperation at the federal state and local levels.   In this week’s column I discuss how I’m striving to ease the economic burden that this virus has caused Nebraskans. https://t.co/4NETLQ59gQ

I'm proud to be a part of the bipartisan task force advising @realDonaldTrump on reopening our economy. We had a productive first call today.  #COVID19 has hurt NE’s families businesses & economy. Working together we can develop safe steps to begin getting people back to work.

I appreciate that the administration approved @GovRicketts’ request for the @NENationalGuard to receive federal funding. This funding will help support our NE Guard members and provide much-needed flexibility in their efforts to combat #COVID19 across our state.

Many of NE’s small businesses have temporarily closed to slow the spread of #COVID19 leading to uncertainty for business owners & their employees. Read in my column about resources provided in the CARES Act for small businesses. #PaycheckProtectionProgram https://t.co/CadKhOVLyo

Even though beef sales are rising during the #COVID19 pandemic America’s cattle producers & feeders aren’t seeing the profits. In fact they are experiencing lower cattle prices and a volatile futures market.  More on steps I’m taking for our producers.⬇️ https://t.co/G3lJJanEO4

Tomorrow is a statewide day of prayer for Nebraska. As we face new challenges I encourage everyone to take time to remember those affected by the coronavirus and the men and women who are on the front lines combatting it. #LoveNE https://t.co/6f8YdkPJ4D

The livestock industry is at the heart of NE’s economy but many cattle producers are failing to see the profits from soaring beef sales during #COVID19.   Read my op-ed on the actions I've taken to ensure the beef industry remains fair and competitive: https://t.co/1zjrP6BHnr

Here in Nebraska @UNMC is using a data dashboard to track and map vulnerable populations and healthcare resources in the fight highly infectious diseases like #COVID19. Learn more here: https://t.co/FLdbIRKbBn

This morning the @SenateCommerce held a paper hearing to examine how new technologies and apps are helping to anonymously track #COVID19 transmission predict new hotspots and evaluate social distancing.

ICYMI: The @USDA will be looking into potential unfair market practices that are happening in our beef supply chain. I appreciate @SecretarySonny taking this step to make sure our cattle producers are treated fairly during the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/QKxAJb4FcK

I spoke with the @USDA who confirmed that the agency will be expanding its Holcomb fire plant investigation to include COVID-19 market disruption. This is what I called for in my letter to USDA yesterday. This is a good decision to address potentially unfair practices.
I also wrote to @SecretarySonny and urging the @USDA to expand its investigation of beef pricing margins to include the #COVID19 market impacts. https://t.co/Bfm7mnALzw
I’ve heard many concerns from Nebraskans about the impact #COVID19 is having on cattle producers and feeders.

The CARES Act provided funding for urban rural & tribal transit ridership programs to help offset a decline in ridership due to #COVID19. Read how this $61 million in relief will help keep our state’s critical transit programs solvent from @NewsChannelNE: https://t.co/bizV8K9QkZ

Thank you @realDonaldTrump for approving a major disaster declaration for Nebraska. This is an important step to unlock additional federal resources for our state as we all continue to work to tackle this pandemic. #COVID19

NE cattle producers have suffered economic hardships and dealt with very volatile markets as a result of the COVID-19 outbreak. I urged @USDA to make sure CARES Act assistance goes to them during this time of crisis. https://t.co/OzzioooVrC

Public transit has seen a significant decline in ridership due to #COVID19. @FTA_DOT has announced NE will receive $61 million in funding through the CARES Act to ensure our public transit providers can keep workers on and remain economically viable. https://t.co/Dl8kKfzWHD

The #COVID19 numbers provided to me by Dr. Fauci during our telephone briefing today were sobering. Americans must strictly adhere to social distancing and comply with all mitigation procedures. For current information continue to watch the administration’s daily briefings.

The CARES Act contains many forms of relief for NE families businesses & communities. As the details roll out I am adding resources to my website with information to inform Nebraskans about what is available to them during this #COVID19 crisis. ⬇️ https://t.co/xXm8bYz115

Today I joined my colleagues for a Sen. Armed Services Committee phone briefing w our top DoD officials focused on our military’s #COVID19 response. Thank you to the men & women of our military for providing assistance during this crisis while they continue to defend our nation

Today I joined my colleagues in sending a letter to @SecretarySonny urging him to use the resources provided in the CARES Act to help our cattle producers who are facing hardship due to the #COVID19 outbreak. More: https://t.co/fcfq4lvpgn https://t.co/4kyx8A7jTY

I led Nebraska’s Congressional delegation in sending a letter to @realDonaldTrump in support of @GovRicketts’ request for a major disaster declaration for Nebraska. As #COVID19 continues to rise in our state we must ensure our communities receive immediate support. https://t.co/Tz2PbCWLH4

Thank you to our doctors and health care workers who are on the front lines of the fight against #COVID19 working to keep Americans safe. I'm especially thankful for the great work of @UNMC @NebraskaMed & all the hospitals in #NE combatting this pandemic. #NationalDoctorsDay

.@USDA’s ReConnect Pilot Program is helping to deploy broadband in underserved rural communities. The agency now is giving extra time to apply for funding – increased by $100M in the CARES Act – in response to #COVID19.    See below for more ⬇️ https://t.co/rfYjx7QFPB

#COVID19 is a national crisis which is why the Senate unanimously passed and @realdonaldtrump signed into law the CARES Act.    Read in this week’s column how the bill will provide relief for Nebraska families businesses ag producers and hospitals. https://t.co/CLJ2RwIkPM
Mourning the loss of the two Nebraskans who passed away from coronavirus. My deepest sympathies are with their families friends and all those who are affected by this disease. https://t.co/goUCKQV7wm
🚨 Here is a great resource for small business owners looking to apply for #COVID19 emergency loans. https://t.co/G0n3bCJe7v

As reports keep coming in that our health care professionals are running out of respirators we were able to pass my bipartisan bill with @SenatorSinema that will make sure America’s first responders and those on the front-line combating #COVID19 have the equipment to stay safe. https://t.co/5p964s70Jo

People are suffering. Small business owners across this country are trying to provide for their employees and working to keep their businesses open.  I’m glad the Senate came together last night to pass the CARES Act to provide relief for those who are hurting. #COVID19 https://t.co/62S6uBi49n
We need to battle this virus provide relief to our people through this unprecedented time and get our economy stabilized. That is why I voted for this coronavirus relief package.
In Nebraska one in four jobs is connected to ag. This legislation increases emergency response funding for producers impacted by #COVID19 so they can continue feeding the world during this crisis.
For our communities it creates a new coronavirus relief fund with $150 billion for state and local governments to help them address this pandemic.
The legislation we passed tonight ensures small and medium-sized businesses can keep their employees working and won’t have to shut their doors for good. #COVID19

We are in a crisis. We must provide people with relief and get our economy on the road to recovery and that is exactly what the bipartisan legislation we passed tonight does. It includes relief for families hospitals businesses and our communities. #COVID19

My Democrat colleagues should save the debate on their wish list issues for another day.   Today let’s give the American people what they need.    That’s relief.    Relief for our families health care workers ag producers and small businesses. #COVID19 https://t.co/mXb0Dbjv6o
Hand sanitizer is an effective way to help slow the spread of coronavirus. Thank you @GPREINC for stepping up to help your fellow Americans. https://t.co/OzrpxJIVzS
If you’re running low on hand sanitizer @BrickwayOmaha is taking action to help.    I love seeing Nebraskans finding new ways to help one another avoid #COVID19.  https://t.co/0ulHaZaoXy

This coronavirus pandemic is adding another dimension to an already battered agriculture economy by driving down crop and livestock prices.    I’ve been working with my colleagues to make sure this emergency package provides relief for our ag producers too.    Let's get it done! https://t.co/M1BcMCkuI9

Nebraska small businesses impacted by coronavirus are now eligible to apply for low-interest federal disaster loans for working capital through @SBAgov to help during these difficult economic times.   Apply here: https://t.co/rjJYPqJv4x

The coronavirus emergency aid proposal includes legislation introduced by @SenatorSinema and myself to ensure our health care work force & first responders have CDC-approved respirators. It’s time to get this done and keep Americans safe.

If you know anyone in Colfax County who is over 65 & needs to be checked on please call (402) 352-7958. Love the initiative this community is taking to help keep each other safe! #COVID19 https://t.co/54GrmLWYGV

In addition to the national @FCC pledge the NE PSC is urging communications carriers in state to keep Nebraskans connected during these difficult and rapidly changing times. This is another important effort that will provide Nebraskans with relief! #COVID19 https://t.co/eEEkfNE1qO

#COVID19 has a widespread impact on everyone across NE including our ag producers. As we continue to combat this virus I encourage Nebraska farmers and ranchers to follow @NEFarmBureau’s checklist to help prepare for what's to come. https://t.co/SATnBswp8y https://t.co/8H46cFF7M9

This national crisis requires a national response and we all have to work together if we are going to stop #COVID19. I am continuing to work on phase three of a relief package that will help Nebraskans and people across the country. https://t.co/PuCMlF7sUz

I am continuing to work on other legislative efforts in the Senate to stabilize the economy and provide the relief Americans need.    My full statement on the Families First Coronavirus Response Act:  https://t.co/AsdJe5GuAl

The purpose of the federal government is to provide a national response during a national emergency. That is why I voted today for the Families First Coronavirus Response Act.   This is part of a multi-step effort intended to combat #COVID19 and help Nebraska families. https://t.co/EWDlmDv6jH
Great tips from @NEFarmBureau on how rural America can be proactive and take #COVID19 seriously. https://t.co/T50D36LSHL
I appreciate what these carriers are doing to keep Nebraskans connected! I hope that all providers across the country can step up to sign the pledge. #COVID19

These carriers pledged to maintain service for all residential and small business subscribers and waive late fees over the next two months related to hardships caused by the coronavirus pandemic as well as open their WiFi hotspots to any American who needs them.

While keeping some water bottles on hand as an added precaution is a smart choice @NEDHHS released a statement today reminding everyone that Nebraska’s tap water is safe to drink. #COVID19 https://t.co/kBkfq8Rqqf
🚨Young people are still at risk of contracting and spreading #COVID19. Please do your part and follow these steps to slow down this pandemic. https://t.co/gOfPizmR8A

🚨 It’s important that everyone in Nebraska and across the country join together to combat #COVID19. This afternoon @realDonaldTrump and the @CDCgov released guidance on ways we can slow the spread of this virus. https://t.co/DnPZCt5Mfh

Nebraskans always know how to help one another when times are tough.  Thank you to everyone at @LPSorg who is working to make sure students have the food and the resources they need while schools are closed to combat #COVID19. https://t.co/y2qkb3ogO0

Great to be on @FCPwithGreta to explain why I’m continuing to push to get my bipartisan N95 respirators bill passed. This will help our manufacturers and distributors produce respirators in a timely manner and help protect our health care workers during this #COVID19 crisis! https://t.co/fbvyuEFADu

Congress needs to act fast so our manufacturers and distributors can keep our health care workforce safe and provide them with NIOSH-approved respirators during emergencies like #COVID19.   Read this op-ed in @thehill on our bipartisan bill:  https://t.co/bNjZilQPR7

Below are resources that are available to help address #COVID19.   ➡️ @NEDHHS’s website has tips on what to if you believe you have been exposed.   ➡️ To reach local #NE health departments: https://t.co/PbWUS3GJpr   ➡️ Dial 211 to call for more info.   & wash your hands.

.@realDonaldTrump made the right move declaring #COVID19 a national emergency. Now even more resources will be available to supplement states and localities. I encourage everyone to continue social distancing thorough hand washing and staying home when sick during this pandemic.

Today the Senate could have passed my bill w/ @SenatorSinema to address the shortage of respirators during this #COVID19 outbreak. As a result of the objection from @SenateDems the health and safety of our health care providers and first responders is at risk. https://t.co/E3Pgq8LxyQ

I’m encouraged to hear progress is being made with House Democrats on my bipartisan legislation that will ensure that our healthcare work force can access respirators while treating coronavirus. It’s time to get this done in the Senate and keep Americans safe. #COVID19

There is a hotline available to answer questions regarding #COVID19. Let others including those who lack computer or internet access know that they can dial 211 for information! https://t.co/UNRB4AGg4r
If you have any questions about #COVID19 or would like to report symptoms below is a list of Nebraska’s county health departments you can contact.   More information: https://t.co/PbWUS3GJpr

I’d like to remind Nebraskans that @NEDHHS has a webpage full of information on what to do if you have traveled to an at-risk country or think you might have been exposed to coronavirus. #COVID19 https://t.co/POJmtqv3HS

Thank you @VP Pence. I’m working hard to get this bipartisan legislation passed to ensure that our communities and healthcare workers have the respirators they need to keep people safe. #COVID19 https://t.co/Lv6OvbEu1u

Nebraskans can take simple steps such as washing their hands thoroughly and staying home when sick to help protect themselves and others as we work to stay ahead of #COVID19. Keep a lookout for more updates from @NEDHHS here: https://t.co/POJmtqdsQk

Nebraskans are doing a great job stabilizing the coronavirus situation in our state. From housing & treating quarantined individuals to evaluating potential treatments I’m proud of @UNMC @NebraskaMed Camp Ashland and our medical practitioners for tackling this virus head-on.

I voted for the coronavirus funding package to help combat this virus. It will help develop a vaccine support state & local gov’t & assist community health centers across America.    I'm proud of everyone at @UNMC @NebraskaMed & Camp Ashland who are responding to this crisis. https://t.co/WWCkkfYs5z

It was nice to have Chancellor @JeffreypGold at today’s #NebraskaBreakfast to give us an update on how @unmc is combatting coronavirus in the United States. Thank you for all the great work the university is doing to keep America safe. #COVID19 https://t.co/i4rYtr95n3
Our bipartisan bill would help ensure manufacturers and distributors can produce additional respirators during this health crisis. #COVID19    Read our bill: https://t.co/A4VGzmdVPb

With the number of coronavirus cases on the rise communities need to be able to quickly access CDC-approved respirators. This is why I introduced legislation with @SenatorSinema @SenSasse @SenHawleyPress & @SenatorRounds to keep Americans safe. #COVID19

.@UNMC and @NebraskaMed are making our state proud through their great work monitoring and treating Americans exposed to #coronavirus. I am so thankful for all they do for Nebraska and the country. #COVID19 https://t.co/50zhOwlHma
